task_description: Facing the building to your North-West (approx. 302°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the main building ahead to estimate its height, so I should tilt upward.
I’m no longer aimed at the NW building (now facing north), so I should rotate back to ~303° while keeping the upward pitch to gauge height.
To estimate the building’s total height I need to see both roofline and ground reference, so I’ll tilt up to capture the top.
The view again snapped to north, so I must rotate left to return to the NW (~303°) while keeping the upward pitch to judge roof height.
Since rotating up keeps resetting me, I’ll estimate from this aligned NW view by moving slightly closer to improve scale cues from windows/floors.
I’m now facing west, so I should rotate slightly right to re-center on the NW (~302°) facade of the target building.
My rotation overshot to NE, so I need to rotate left to about 303° to face the target building again.
I need a small rightward yaw from 276° to reach ~302° and face the building directly.
Yaw changes are wrapping oddly, so I’ll use the provided LEFT look to jump to ~296° which is close to the desired 302°.
I’m at 270° and need to face ~302°, so I should rotate about 32° to the right.
The LEFT preset will put me exactly at the desired ~302° heading toward the building.
Controls keep snapping me back, but I can still estimate from the visible facade; I’ll stop with a reasonable height based on apparent 3-story massing.
